Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2017 07:37PM - edited Oct 22, 2017 07:38PM by Momcat1962 Hello, I had a large area excised in 2013 and ADH was found in my LEFT breast. It didn't show up on two ductograms, a mammo, an U/S, or MRI. It was incidental due to some very dark discharge that tested positive for blood. I have had an MRI every year since, and have had mammo and U/Ss every 6 months the last 2 years. I had spontaneous discharge three weeks ago from my right breast , lots of pain, was told probably mastitis by my breast surgeon and put on antibiotics. A few days later had my scheduled mammo and U/S and was dismissed by the radiologist as "Looks fine. See you in a year." He was very quick and dismissive (thats what I get I guess for scheduling late in the day??) , and this appt was a 6 month follow up to "3 areas of interest". (report said "extremely dense breasts and not abe to see anything due to this") I go for a 6 month follow up MRI in 2 months for another area of interest in my right breast that gave me non-bloody spontaneous discharge 3 weeks ago. Oddly, today I awoke to blood on my shirt, and much more after slight manipulation on the right side. I was never offered drugs for the ADH. (I am 55 and post menopausal.) I would have it looked at if I were you. Better to be safe. Please update when you can. (I called my BS and left a message today about the bloody discharge so I'm not sure what her protocol will be...)  Cat

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2013 06:19PM - edited Aug 6, 2013 06:35PM by Momcat1962 Thank you, Ballet 12. I had a diagnostic mammo on both breasts and diagnostic u/s on my RIGHT breast in late April. My right breast is "achy" as is my underarm. They found nothing in the u/s or mammo. About as week later I had spontaneous black discharge from my LEFT breast. I called my gyn' s office and they made an appt with a surgeon who wanted a galactogram and ultrasound of the LEFT breast. Both looked fine; no blockages. Some ductal ecstasia noted (like in 2006.) Anyway...the bloody discharge never resolved and the MRI report noted fluid, blood, proteinaceous debris so I could do another MRI in 6 months or excise the duct. The surgeon is a not "wait and see" in cases like mine so the excision and lumpectomy happened last week. That's where I got the ADH diagnosis. (Also, preoperative galactogram followed by a wire loc now revealed a blocked duct.)

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2013 08:38PM - edited Apr 15, 2013 08:47PM by Momcat1962 Went to my appointment. Newer GYN pretty much blew me off...wondering if he even knows anything about BC. I told him of my many tests, procedures, issues, etc...over the last 20 yrs. He commented that my right side (under arm) was "indeed thicker than the left so I will send you for a mammogram. Let's hope it is only lymph nodes...". I asked if they would be able to see the area in question where I felt two small lumps. He said, " Probably not. But you are only 50 so a routine mammogram will be fine."...WHAT!!?? With my history?? I haven't had a "routine" mammo in about 10 yrs. I left my former GYN of 15 yrs because he botched my sister's c-section, but his mom died of BC so he was very diligent. I told this new guy that I wanted s diagnostic WITH ultrasound! He told his nurse, "Ok...call in a diagnostic mammogram and if they see a need they can ultrasound." ......I give up! I did explain that the nodules /lumps were not painful just an aching that goes down the INNER arm sometimes and a couple of stabbing pains in the breasts this week.

Posts.Title: MRI Scheduled bigallilsyd Momcat1962

Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2009 11:20AM Momcat1962 wrote: I have had 2 MRIs on my breasts. I can only tell you about my experience. They have you lie ona table, tummy down. Your breasts are hanging in two holes in the table . (Kind of weird, I know.) They place an IV into you for the contrast dye. Your arms will be resting on arm-like grips hooked to the table. I got ear plugs, and headphones with music so I couldn't hear the MRI machine. hah...you can still hear the machine somewhat. It took about 30 mins or so. They slide the table into a tube space and take their films. I am a bit claustraphobic, so i closed my eyes the entire time. It isn't bad really...hope this helps..like I said, not bad at all...just boring. :) God Bless...let us know how it goes, if you can!

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2013 10:37PM - edited Jun 12, 2013 10:40PM by Momcat1962 I go on Friday for an MRI for nipple discharge that has blood in it. It is very dark..almost black. Nothing really showed up on the mammo, u/s, or galactogram (very dense breasts). The discharge comes from the same duct, spontaneously and expressed. When expressed that side of the areola is painful...at 3 o'clock. I also have a "dent" just below the nipple tip at 3 o'clock when the nipple is erect. I can fit my pinky finger tip in it.
